title: [Bug]race condition using file system as Mlflow backend

labels.name: area/scoring
labels.description: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs

body:
Thank you for submitting an issue. Please refer to our [issue policy](https://www.github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/master/ISSUE_POLICY.md) for additional information about bug reports. For help with debugging your code, please refer to [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/mlflow).

**Please fill in this bug report template to ensure a timely and thorough response.**

### Willingness to contribute
The MLflow Community encourages bug fix contributions. Would you or another member of your organization be willing to contribute a fix for this bug to the MLflow code base?

- [ ] Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.
- [ ] Yes. I would be willing to contribute a fix for this bug with guidance from the MLflow community.
- [ ] No. I cannot contribute a bug fix at this time.

### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: 
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: ubuntu:18.04 and MacOS
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: pip install
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: running into same issue with all versions including 1.19 and 1.22
- **Python version**: 3.7  

### Describe the problem
We are developing an MLflow and groupby applyInPandas framework for fitting and logging sklearn models in parallel. We are attempting to run unit tests for the framework locally and somewhat randomly get an error (which appears to be due to a  Race condition)
We install MLflow and Spark on the CICD server and are using the local file system as the backend store for MLflow. The error culprit is with mlflow.start_run(): statement that is called from the UDF.
When this statement is run on the server, it searched in the local filesystem for a meta.yaml file containing information about the experiment run. MLflow attempts to copy this file, and if the file is empty, throws the error we are seeing: *AttributeError: ‘NoneType’ object has no attribute ‘copy’.*
The test in question runs on two groups (referred to as Process A and Process B below); this is the behavior we are seeing…
Process A reads the meta.yaml file
Process A modifies the contents in memory
Process A starts writing the meta.yaml file
At this point, Process A creates an empty meta.yaml file
Process B reads the meta.yaml file
The file is there, but it’s **empty**
Process B returns a None dictionary (there was nothing in meta.yaml)
Process A flushes the in-memory contents to disk
Process B tries to call `.copy()` on a None object

### Code to reproduce issue
Provide a reproducible test case that is the bare minimum necessary to generate the problem.

### Other info / logs
Include any logs or source code that would be helpful to diagnose the problem. If including tracebacks, please include the full traceback. Large logs and files should be attached.
